head: Divorce Notice.
ab: TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, Second Judicial District, County of Thurston.
p: To Henry D. Webster:—You are hereby notified that Margaret Webster has filed a complaint against you in the United States District Court, within and for the 2d Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, holding terms at Olympia in said Territory, which will come on to be heard before the Hon. C. C. Hewitt, Chief Justice of the Territory of Washington, and Judge of said 2d Judicial District, at chambers on Thursday the 20th day of July 1865, at 11 o'clock A.M., in the forenoon of said day, the same being thirty days or more after the date of said publication of this notice. And unless you appear as before notified and answer, the same will be taken as confessed, and the decree and relief therein prayed for will be granted.
The object and prayer of said complaint is to obtain a decree of Divorce on the ground of abandonment for over one year.
Complaint filed June 17th, 1865. Olympia, W. T., June 17th 1855.
ANDREW J. MOSES, Att'y for Plaintiff.
